title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 13 January 2016 - XWiki
content: has quit 00:57  has quit 01:13  has joined #xwiki 01:42  has quit 01:58  has joined #xwiki 02:02  has quit 02:10  has quit 02:44  has joined #xwiki 02:44  hello 02:44  anyone around? 02:46  having a problem with color theme editing (cerulean). I change the navbar bg color variable, and it reflects on the preview, then I save but it does not reflect on the wiki. Can't figure out what is wrong. Any hints? tia 02:47  ah.. nevermind.. had to force browser refresh, it was cached.. 02:47  :9 02:47  has quit 03:30  nah, noone is around 04:20  has joined #xwiki 06:43  has joined #xwiki 07:37  has quit 07:44  has joined #xwiki 08:45  has joined #xwiki 08:51  has joined #xwiki 08:54  has joined #xwiki 09:18  tmortagne: good morning 09:18  question, in the doc at http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/XWiki+Commons+-+Extension+-+Repository+-+Maven#HCustomproperties it says: 09:19  " • root namespace: or <>" 09:19  do I have to use "" or just "root"? 09:19  my guess is "root" but it's mislezding 09:21  it's 09:21  so: <root> ? 09:21  it's a keyword, it's not the name of that namespace since that namespace is null 09:21  I need to put that in the pom.xml and thus escape < and > 09:21  not very convenient :) 09:22  s/convenient/readable 09:23  right, it's actually a generic syntax and not specifically a maven one, would indeed be nice to have a more XML oriented one 09:23  ok I'm testing with: <root> 09:24  just need to find another not too common character which is not [] (which is used for regex) 09:24  I guess {root} would do 09:24  empty? 09:24  empty means empty list 09:24  it needs to be something 09:24  then empty means not installable anywhere 09:24  yes 09:25  doesn't make much sense 09:25  :) 09:25  does it? 09:25  there are uc? 09:25  I prefer something more explicit 09:25  yes I agree actually 09:26  there is no reason empty means more root that anywhere 09:26  well you did it :) 09:26  with <> 09:26  ;) 09:26  <> is a key work 09:26  not an empty list 09:26  sure bot not explicit 09:26  it's a single element 09:27  honreslty I'd prefer only 1 way of specifying it 09:27  {root} or something else but just one way to prevent having various usages 09:27  has joined #xwiki 09:28  hmm deosn't seem to work 09:28  I tried to install my extension and clicked "install" instead of "install on farm" 09:28  and it's telling me my extension is going to install in wiki home 09:28  I haven't clicked continue yet 09:28  is the check after continue? 09:29  (in which case we should improve it since it's misleading) 09:29  no it's in the plan and I have an integration test with it so that's weird 09:30  I'm using: 09:30  <root> 09:30  is that correct? 09:30  should be, my integration test is not based on maven 09:31  but I have a unit test chekcing the convertion from Model to Extension and it looks ok too 09:31  I'm going to commit it so that you can test it, ok? 09:31  you should wait that I introduce {root} syntax probably 09:32  we can modify it then 09:33  I don't see the rush, does not take long to add new keywork for root 09:33  the rush is to fix the bug 09:33  using {root} or l&t;root> is not the primary concern 09:34  unless this is what is causing the bug ;) 09:34  (the encoding) 09:34  it's not like you were going to release this right now 09:35  no but I'm moving on to something else now 09:36  has joined #xwiki 09:50  mflorea: good morning 09:51  vmassol: good morning 09:51  when my vfstree macro fails for some reason the tree just fails to load. Is there a way for my JSON to return some error so that the underlying {{tree}} macro will report an error to the user? 09:51  in my case it's a permission error that makes the json not return what it should and I'd like to tell the user about it 09:52  should I create a node with the error as the node text? :) 09:52  or is there a better way? 09:52  (couldn't find error handling on http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Tree+Widget#HDynamicData) 09:54  it depends where the tree macro fails. "s there a way for my JSON to return some error" --> this assumes that the error is in the JSON, but it can also be in the JavaScript code or in the Velocity code of the macro 09:55  in my case I'd like to return some error from the JSON 09:55  (ie from my json page) 09:56  this json tries to get some attachment info but if the user doesn't have permissions returns an empty list now and the user will see something empty and will wonder what happened 09:56  I'd like to return the exception that I get from the backend 09:56  (where it says that the problem is a permission issue on such archive) 09:56  has joined #xwiki 09:56  what you can do for now is to return a fake node that has the error message in its label 09:57  ok that was my suggestion 09:57  so there's no specific error handling fro this in the tree ATM 09:57  I'll create a jira issue as improvement for later on, ok? 09:58  can i return HTML as the node lavel? 09:58  \*label 09:58  (vmassol: looks like my test was getting an error as expected but not the right error so indeed there is an issue with allowed namespace validation) 09:58  because a stack trace is pretty long and I'll need to have the node label clickable in the same way as we do for macro errros 09:58  tmortagne: ok 09:59  I can also get the root cause for no 09:59  \*now 10:00  hmm  it's hard actually… 10:01  no it's ok forget it, I just need to modify the NIOTool 10:02  I disabled HTML in node label. You can enabled it for your tree but then you need to HTML-encode all the labels that are not supposed to have HTML (e.g. file names) 10:04  you don't need to put all the info in the node label. You can put it in the node data, and then from JS you can listen when the tree is loaded and check if the tree has a single node with type "error" (that you previously set), and if that's the case you take the error info from the node data 10:05  has joined #xwiki 10:06  that's probably a bit involved for me right now but it's a good idea, actually it could possibly even described and documented on that tree page on exo with an example ;) 10:06  entering meeting 10:10  Hi, someone had working a little bit on font awesome? because I have a very strange bug on xwiki 7.0.1 I can't understand 10:10  If I use to display a tiny globe character with font awesome, I use this HTML code on a page: (between {{html}} tags but it didn't display globe icone ... except on welcome page of xwiki (in display gadget) ... but only if I'm logon with Admin user :-( 10:10  If someone have an idea where I can search a fix? Thxs 10:10  (I use FF) 10:10  has joined #xwiki 10:11  has joined #xwiki 10:17  has joined #xwiki 10:20  Ok I know resolv my problem (I read source code of http://design.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Proposal/IconSet) then I must add this ssx  $xwiki.linkx.use('//maxcdn.bootstrapcdn.com/font-awesome/4.2.0/css/font-awesome.min.css', {'rel': 'stylesheet'} 10:21  It is strange because CSS file is on resources/webjars/font-awesome/4.2.0/css/font-awesome.min.css 10:22  I though we don't need to call this CSS :-( 10:28  vmassol: you can close XWIKI-12991 (unless there is something else) 10:29  tmortagne: you tested it and it works? 10:29  (just checkin if I need to restest before closingà 10:29  ) 10:30  did not tested this exact extension but I tested that you can't install on a wiki an extension with {root} 10:30  ok thanks for the fix, I'll retest then 10:30  (after my meeting, I'm in a meeting now 10:30  ) 10:52  has joined #xwiki 11:15  guys, any idea how to get the velocity context in a nice way from within a {{velocity}} macro? 11:15  (without having to know the key under which it's stored in the xwiki context) 11:16  forget that, I'll do my stuff differently 11:18  has joined #xwiki 11:18  $xcontext 11:18  to late :-) 11:18  has quit 11:18  \*too 11:18  Pbas: FYI $xcontext is the xwiki context not the velocity context 11:18  :) 11:18  but thanks anyway! 11:19  argh wrong answer 11:19  has joined #xwiki 11:19  has quit 11:19  anyway forget it, I've found another way 11:19  (better) 11:19  has joined #xwiki 11:20  :-) I knew it (you found a grovy or java things) 11:37  has quit 11:46  has left #xwiki 12:10  has quit 12:11  has joined #xwiki 13:02  has quit 13:04  has joined #xwiki 13:09  has joined #xwiki 14:44  Hi. Have you already noticed the following bug on a recent snapshot?: http://pasteboard.co/Lp9r5NN.png 14:46  nope 14:46  (I built yesterday but not this morning) 14:49  stack trace: http://pastebin.com/raw/JAkgJCat 14:50  hmm I think I remember seeing a change from mflorea this morning on the DAB 14:50  mflorea: your commit might explain this: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/484d284ddee9a82d2005ce0a1812d1592b96d18e 14:50  yes that's the one I rmeember 14:51  I didn't touch the DAB 14:51  that's an internal component, what's the problem? 14:51  java.lang.AbstractMethodError at runtime usually means that some jar is no up to date in the WAR 14:52  otherwise it would not build 14:52  ah yes it waasn't the DAB, got misled by the name , sorry 14:52  but 14:53  it's still  com.xpn.xwiki.internal.sheet.DefaultModelBridge.isCurrentDocument(Lorg/xwiki/bridge/DocumentModelBridge;)Z 14:53  so it does seem related to your commit 14:53  yes, but maybe CI didn't build all the affected modules 14:54  looks like oldocore and xwiki-platform-sheet-api and not in sync in the WAR 14:54  s/and not/are not/ 14:54  lots of test failure in platform 14:56  both oldcore and sheet-api have been build successfully from what I can see on http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/2387/ 14:57  but the entire build was aborted 14:59  hmm Ive build my snapshot at the wrong time 15:14  has quit 15:56  has quit 15:57  has joined #xwiki 16:45  has quit 17:11  I've rebuild an XE and it's ok nox 17:11  \*now 17:21  cool 17:44  has quit 18:00  @evalica: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9640 and http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9639 are dups? 18:02  vmassol: not really …. one is sorting List of users. the other is sorting on name instead of id. 18:02  but they are sure related …. 18:03  what's the difference? 18:03  from an implementation point of view I don't know if it's a difference 18:03  right now when you have a list of users you can only sort by id 18:03  what we need is sorting by name 18:03  so XWIKI-9640 work today 18:03  but you need to use the id 18:04  ah sorting, not filtering 18:04  I was talking about filtering 18:04  ... 18:04  so one is about sorting while the other one is about filtering 18:04  got it 18:05  but it's the same issue in both cases 18:05  filtering/sorting is done in the request on a single field 18:05  you can close XWIKI-9640 if you want - since it's more ambiguous 18:06  although on XWIKI-9640 we might disable sorting of it doesn't work … 18:06  \*if 18:16  has quit 18:16  has quit 18:28  has quit 18:39  has quit 18:48  has quit 18:55  has quit 19:03  has joined #xwiki 19:08  has quit 19:10  has joined #xwiki 19:26  has joined #xwiki 19:32  has quit 20:24  has quit 20:55  has quit 22:01  has quit 22:06  has joined #xwiki 22:14  has quit 22:52  has joined #xwiki 22:57  has joined #xwiki 22:59  has quit 23:20  has quit 23:54  has quit
